text:
Hi Khadijah! 

Good to hear from you. 

When you say work experience, do you mean like short-term unpaid work? 

How are you assignments going by the way? Managing okay to complete them?

Did you complete your CV okay?

Yes, as an International Super Tutor, over the past three years I have been to some amazing places and had incredible experiences. These have included placements in Florida, South of France (St Tropez), the Greek Islands, the Swiss Alps, Monaco, on a a yacht in Indonesia.....the list could go on. 

A typical day for me is just fours, say 9:30am to 1:30pm, tutoring my student one-to-one. We study wherever they prefer in their home - usually a study room or dining room, but sometimes even on a sunny terrace (in Greece) or out in the garden if the weather is nice! If they are losing their focus, we take a break - maybe play a game, or Xbox, or go outside for a bit - whatever brings their focus back to study after. Lunch is always with the family together, or perhaps in a restaurant. After lunch, my work day is done and I am free to do whatever I like for the rest of the day! :) 

This demonstrates that nowadays there are so many different, unusual and spectacular jobs out there, and also that work hours do not have to be typical, fixed 9-5. They can be much shorter, and more flexible - like mine! 

As your mentor, Iâ€™m keen to expand your horizons in terms of what is possible and what is out there! :)

yh my assignments are too much but I made a plan of what is more important and urgent to least...
hope it helps started it this week so I am trying to see how useful it will be...
 
I haven't focused on my cv much because of my hw but yh I have made a few changes
